metadata.title: CVE-2020-10703 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low
metadata.description:
A NULL pointer dereference was found in the libvirt API responsibleintroduced in upstream version 3.10.0, and fixed in libvirt 6.0.0, forfetching a storage pool based on its target path. In more detail, this flawaffects storage pools created without a target path such as network-basedpools like gluster and RBD. Unprivileged users with a read-only connectioncould abuse this flaw to crash the libvirt daemon, resulting in a potentialdenial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10703` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-libvirt - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-clients - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-daemon - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-daemon-driver-lxc - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-daemon-driver-qemu - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-gluster - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-rbd - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-zfs - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-daemon-driver-vbox - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-daemon-driver-xen - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-daemon-system - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-daemon-system-systemd - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-daemon-system-sysv - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-sanlock - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-wireshark - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt0 - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvirt package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.0-0ubuntu6').
